item.content:encoded: Image: Bureau 81/Indienova Computer, enhance. My god, that‚Äôs our killer Knowledge is power, and there are few games where that‚Äôs as literal as The Operator. The Operator is an indie game where you take up the role of Evan Tanner, a fresh-faced recruit at the Federal Department of Intelligence (FDI). It‚Äôs the early ‚Äô90s, and an old buddy has hooked you up with this cushy government gig. All you have to do is master a set of high-tech tools and serve as the man in the chair for agents on the fro...

item.description: Image: Le Scorpion Masqu√©/Hachette The hit of Gen Con 2023 wins the Spiel des Jahres Nearly a full year after sticking the landing at Gen Con in Indianapolis, Sky Team has won the Spiel des Jahres, ...
item.content:encoded: Image: Le Scorpion Masqu√©/Hachette The hit of Gen Con 2023 wins the Spiel des Jahres Nearly a full year after sticking the landing at Gen Con in Indianapolis, Sky Team has won the Spiel des Jahres, the prestigious German award given to the best board game of the year. The announcement, made Sunday in a blog post, formally welcomes the hit cooperative game to the ranks of modern classics such as Catan, Carcassonne, and Ticket to Ride. In Sky Team, players take on the role of the pilot and co-pi...

item.content:encoded: Image: Ravensburger/Disney Ravensburger‚Äôs new starter kit has everything you need to learn and enjoy The biggest challenge for any trading cards game, especially as it matures and the sheer volume of content expands, is creating entry points for players to dive in without feeling intimidated by ever-expanding complexity. item.content:encoded: Image: Jordan Mochi/Catchweight Studio/Team17 Welcome to hell ‚Äî don‚Äôt forget your shovel The first World War is often given short shrift when it comes to its place in Americans‚Äô cultural memory, especially compared to World War II. The reasons for this are as myriad as they are obvious; World War II has a clearly definable antagonist in the form of the Axis Powers led by Nazi Germany, while World War I could be more aptly described as a cat‚Äôs cradle of trade alliances mired in a sinkhole of mi...

item.content:encoded: Image: Paul Hart, Lee Williams/Akupara Games I‚Äôve made some mistakes in my life You‚Äôll type a lot in Cryptmaster, but I wouldn‚Äôt call it a typing game. No, Cryptmaster is a word game: The dungeon-crawling adventure is all about finding the right word for a whole bunch of different wacky scenarios. Typing is how you use that power.
